info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 4 at 4:13AM CDT until July 4 at 7:15AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
FFWSJT
The National Weather Service in San Angelo has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northeastern Tom Green County in west central Texas...
* Until 715 AM CDT.
* At 408 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing very heavy rain across the warned area. Between 6 and 10 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. This is a very dangerous situation. Expect roads washed out and rapid rises on rivers and creeks. Very dangerous flash flooding is currently on going.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for Grape Creek to the northern part of San Angelo. This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing very heavy rainfall and flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Angelo, Grape Creek and O.c. Fisher Reservoir.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Arroyos, streams, and rivers can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR GRAPE CREEK TO THE NORTHERN PART OF SAN ANGELO
NWS: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY this area til 7:15 AM CDT. Avoid flooded areas.

National Weather Service: A FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY is in effect for this area until 7:15 AM CDT. This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR GRAPE CREEK TO THE NORTHERN PART OF SAN ANGELO
SNM: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS hasta 7:15 AM CDT. Evite areas inundadas.

Servicio Nacional de Meteorologia: EMERGENCIA DE INUNDACIONES REPENTINAS en efecto para esta area hasta las 7:15 AM CDT. Esta es una situacion extremadamente peligrosa y amenaza la vida. No intente viajar a menos que sea para abandonar un area propensa a inundaciones o bajo una orden de desalojo.
